org.jerkar.api.depmanagement

Class JkDepExclude

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jerkar.api.depmanagement.JkDepExclude
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public final class JkDepExclude
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Information about excluding artifacts or whole modules.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • of

        public static JkDepExclude of(JkModuleId moduleId)
        Creates an exclusion of the specified module.

      • of

        public static JkDepExclude of(java.lang.String group,
                              java.lang.String name)
        Creates an exclusion of the specified module.

      • of

        public static JkDepExclude of(java.lang.String groupAndName)
        Creates an exclusion of the specified module.

      • withType

        public JkDepExclude withType(java.lang.String typeArg)
        Returns an exclusion identical to this one but with the specified type. Types generally corresponds to getExtension or classifier but not always. Some examples are jar, test-jar, test-client.

      • withExt

        public JkDepExclude withExt(java.lang.String extension)
        Returns an exclusion identical to this one but with the specified getExtension. Types generally corresponds to getExtension or classifier but not always. Some examples are jar, test-jar, test-client.

      • withScopes

        public JkDepExclude withScopes(JkScope... scopes)
        Returns a exclusion identical to this one but narrowed to the specified scopes. When some scopes are defined, the exclusion is effective only if the dependency likely to hold the module to exclude is declared with one of the specified scopes.

      • getModuleId

        public JkModuleId getModuleId()
        Returns the module id to exclude.

      • getType

        public java.lang.String getType()
        Returns the type of the artifact file to exclude.

      • getExt

        public java.lang.String getExt()
        Returns the getExtension for the artifact files to exclude. If not null only file artifact having this getExtension will be effectively excluded.

      • getScopes

        public java.util.Set<JkScope> getScopes()
        Returns the scopes that render the exclusion effective.
        See Also:
        withScopes(JkScope...)
